cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 mi NW of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest, expected to pass near Turks and Caicos and the Bahamas, then turn toward the south-eastern Florida peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Florida (Keys or extreme southern peninsula)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for Florida as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for Florida as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeastern Florida Atlantic coast from the Keys through Palm Beach County and northward along the peninsula
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (≥63%) of sustained tropical-storm to hurricane-force winds with peak onset probability of 49% between 72–96 h (Sunday).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Increasing risk of storm surge above 3 ft along the southeast Florida coast, including Palm Beach County, especially if the center tracks just offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts, producing flash flooding in low-lying port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and possible tornadoes embedded in rain bands affecting port operations.
